section.html: Providing the most effective home security and crime prevention products in the UK!

Home and Personal Safety

Preventing criminal acts from happening to you and your family is about looking around at your home, your personal safety and considering how a burglar or criminal might take advantage of your situation.

Theft of personal property such as mobile phones, laptops, iPods etc are often carried out by thieves who see an opportunity for an easy steal.

The same can be said about your home. Look at it through a burglars eyes, if you think there are areas which don't look secure, chances are, so does a burglar.

Take the time to look at your home space, your personal belongings and the personal safety of yourself and your loved ones and make simple but effective changes which really can help preventing you from becoming a victim of crime.

How Can We Help?

We know how to help increase overall safety and security, to combat and to help reduce crime.

Redline Security is a sister company of Solon Security, who has over 18 years’ experience providing crime prevention and community safety items solely to the police, councils and local government and have developed products and solutions over time that really do work.

A burglary or a criminal act can be a very upsetting experience, and can leave you and your loved ones feeling vulnerable and anxious.

Have a look at our security tips, advice and essential security items to help ensure your home is as secure as can be.

Our products have been used and deployed by the police for nearly 20 years meaning we supply only the best and most reliable security products on the market for a low cost price.

Send Testimonial

Redline Security is a sister company of Solon Security, who has almost 20 years worth of experience providing crime prevention products and solutions solely to the police, councils and charity organisations.

Criminal acts, burglaries, anti-social behaviour and thefts can be a very upsetting experience for the victim involved. We are dedicated to providing you with the most innovative, high quality products at an affordable price, ensuring everyone can be safe and secure. We pride ourselves on understanding crime prevention and community safety needs as a result of almost 20 years or working with the police, understanding what they use and require day to day to help support the community.

We are now able to provide our knowledge and product range directly to you.

section.html:
Did you know that 1 in 3 students in Britain become a victim of crime? Whether this is from theft, attack or burglary the effects can be devastating. 

Make sure you protect yourself or your loved ones with some simple but effective products. 

Take a look at our security pages for further advice and tips on staying safe while at university.

page.title: Defender Mini Bag/Purse Alarm
page.description: Small and compact Bag and Purse Alarm.

section.html:
Product Details

This small and compact alarm is a great key chain / bag charm which looks attractive in design and if activated releases a loud 110 decibel alarm.

It's the smallest alarm from the Defender range and can be used to protect bags and purses. Using the lanyard you attach one end to your purse or your clothing, i.e a belt loop, and the other end to your handbag. If someone tries to take your bag or your purse the pin will be released and trigger the siren. Can also be used as a personal alarm in case of attack.

Features

  • Silver finish
  • Small and compact design
  • Attractive bag charm
  • Helps to prevent bag theft
  • Triggers 110dBs alarm if bag is snatched

page.title: Defender Heart Purse/Bag Alarm
page.description: The popular Defender Heart Alarm now available as a Purse / Bag alarm.
page.keywords: Defender Heart Alarm, Defender, Heart, Alarm, attack alarm, rape alarm, bag theft,bag mugging, purse theft, bag snathing, bag dipping, mugging, theft prevention, personal alarm

section.html:
Product Details

The popular Defender Heart Alarm is now available as a bag alarm, designed to protect bags and purses.

This small and compact alarm is a great key chain / bag charm which looks attractive in design and if activated releases a very loud 130 decibel alarm.

Using the lanyard you attach one end to your purse or your clothing, i.e a belt loop, and the other end to your handbag. If someone tries to take your bag or your purse the pin will be released and trigger the siren.

Features

  • Popular heart design
  • Attractive bag charm
  • Prevents bag theft
  • 130dBs alarm
  • Ripcord activation

page.title: Purse Dipping Bells
page.description: Jingle Bells! A great way to let you know if your purse is being snatched.
page.keywords: purse bell, Bag theft, bag dipping bells, pursebell, mugging, theft prevention, bag theft, bag dipping, gold purse bells

section.html:
Product Details

These Jingle Bells are a very simple but effective way to stop and deter thieves. These are especially popular for use in busy shopping areas or whilst using public transport when you are most likely to have your valuables stolen.

They are two little bells which jingle when your purse is being moved. If you were not looking and someone tried to take your purse, the bells will jingle and the thief will be caught red handed.

Highly successful method of stopping thieves from purse snatching

Features

  • Gold finish
  • Always know if your purse is being moved
  • Simple, effective device
  • Highly popular crime prevention tool
  • Ideal for commuting, shopping and traveling
  • Can be used on bags, purses or any other valuable item
  • G-Clip attachment

 

As seen on news articles across the country:

Lancaster Guardian

page.title: Bag Hanger
page.description: A portable bag hook to ensure you always have a place to keep your bag securely under the table.
page.keywords: Bag Hanger, Bag hook, bag theft, chelsea clip,

section.html:
Product Details

The Bag Hanger is a clever little hook that you can carry around in the pouch provided and when you sit down at a table you can hook the top round face on top of the table and let the rest of the device hang down enabling you to hang your bag under the table next to you.

This is ideal for cafes, restaurants, libraries - in fact, anywhere you may put your bag down.

Not only does it keep it out of reach of thieves but it also keeps walk ways clear and prevents your bag from getting dirty or walked on. The perfect solution!

Features

  • Portable
  • Comes with handy carry pouch
  • Keeps bag close to you and 'In Sight, In Mind'
  • Prevents bag theft
  • Helps keep walk ways free and prevents people from standing on your bag
  • Prevents your bag from being left on a dirty floor.

page.title: Chelsea Clip
page.description: A great way to ensure people always have a place to keep their bags in a secure way away from theives.
page.keywords: Chelsea Clip, bag hook, bag hanger, bag theft, bag hook for bars

section.html:
Product Details

The Chelsea Clip has been designed to provide a solution to preventing bag theft in bars, restaurants or other public places.

This is a permanent fixture which bars, libraries, cafes, schools etc. can install underneath table tops to allow visitors to place their bag in a secure and discrete place. To remove the bag you need to use two hands which means that a thief would not easily be able to remove the bag.

Chelsea Clips not only prevent bag theft but also help keep walk ways clear and prevent bags from being walked on or damaged. Stickers available.

Features

  • Two hands required to remove bag preventing theft
  • Helps reduce slips, trips and falls
  • Ideal for public venues such as bars, restaurants, pubs, libraries or any where a bag may be left vulnerable
  • Easy installation - adhesive pad supplied
  • Stickers available to encourage people to use the hooks

page.title: Chelsea Clip Table Stickers (Sheet of 20)
page.description: For use with Chelsea Clips, helps to let people know the the clips are available underneath tables.
page.keywords: Chelsea Clip Stickers, SelectaClip, Chelsea clip signs, bag hook, bag hanger, bag theft

section.html:
Product Details

These are a great way to let people know your establishment provides Chelsea Clips to keep their property secure.

Keeping these stickers in full view means more people will be aware and will make the most out of the Chelsea Clips.

Features

  • Ideal for use on most surfaces
  • Promote use of Chelsea Clips
  • 20 Stickers per pack

page.title: ZipClip Carabiner Hook
page.description: Keep your zips and bag loops hooked together, prevents bag dipping.
page.keywords: ZipClip, Zip Clip, Carabiner Hook, Bag dipping, zip locks, zip hooks, bag theft, purse theft, bag snatching

section.html:
Product Details

Using Carabiner Hooks to prevent bag theft was originally introduced by the British Transport Police to help tackle the growing problem on the rail network.

It is a great way to keep your zips together and secure. It would take two hands to unhook the carabiner hook and it would take far too long to unhook the carabiner to release the zips.

Thieves will target bags which look unsecured and less risky to get into.

Can be used to connect two zips together, or one zip to a bag hoop. Ideal for any type of bag including rucksacks, handbags and sports bags.

Features

  • Keeps zips secures to each other or to a bag loop
  • Prevents bag dipping
  • Used by the British Transport Police
  • Ideal for traveling, commuting and shopping

page.title: Security Phone Screen Wipe
page.description: A promotional mobile phone charm which encourages people to keep theft phone secure.
page.keywords: Phone charm, mobile phone charm, mobile phone wipe, screen wipe, phone screen wipe, promotional phone screen wipe, phone theft

section.html:
Product Details

KEEP IT HIDDEN! A great way to keep your phone clean and remind you to make sure your phone is not left available for thieves.

These have previously been used to supply promotional campaigns with give-aways to remind people to keep it hidden, perfect for students, staff or commuters.

Features

  • High quality screen wipe
  • Warning message to keep your phone away from thieves
  • Uses phone loop to attach
  • Could also be used on MP3 players or other devices

page.title: Phone Security Cable Black
page.description: Keep your phone secure on a bungee style cable to prevent it from dropping, smashing or from being stolen.
page.keywords: Phone security cable, phone cable, phone bungee cord, phone bunjee, mobile phone cord, mobile phone retractable cable

section.html:
Product Details

The Mobile Phone Cable is a great way to ensure your phone is always at hand and cannot be dropped, smashed or stolen.

It's rubber loop design means any phone can be secured to an extendable 'bungee' style cable and attached to clothing or bags.

If you phone is dropped it will not hit the floor but just bounce back up. Also, its a great way to make sure you can quickly access your phone.

Simple to use, just attach the rubber loop length ways across your phone and attach the G-Clip to your bag loop or clothing.

Features

  • Black finish
  • For use on mobile phones, ipods, wallets or other valuables
  • Prevents dropping, smashing and theft

page.description: Keep your phone secure on a bungee style cable to prevent it from dropping, smashing or from being stolen.
page.keywords: Phone security cable, phone cable, phone bungee cord, phone bunjee, mobile phone cord, mobile phone retractable cable

section.html:

page.title: Secret Pocket
page.description: The secret pocket is a great way to keep your valuables close to hand and secure from pick pocketers.
page.keywords: secret pocket, money belt, hidden money bag, security travel bag, travel purse, commuting purse, body strap bag

section.html:
Product Details

The Secret Pocket is an essential theft prevention item enabling you to keep your valuables hidden and secure.

Commuting, travelling or shopping are times when thieves are most likely to make their move. Wearing a bag such as this enables your to keep your valuables close to your body or underneath clothing meaning thieves cannot gain access.

Ideal for carrying cash, cards, passports, jewellery, keys and other small valuables.

Features

  • Body strap
  • Can be worn under coats or clothing
  • Handy pocket space
  • Ideal for traveling, shopping and commuting

page.title: Mini Window Chime & Alarm
page.description: The Solon Magnetic Chime/Alarm is a low cost, easy to use alarm and chime which will detect when a window or door has opened. Ideal to prevent sneak-in burglary. For use on door, windows and cupboards.
page.keywords: Solon Security, magnetic chime/alarm, magnetic contact alarm, window alarm, door alarm, cupboard alarm, door chime, window chime, visitor chime.

section.html:
Product Details

The alarm comes in two parts which are connected via a magnetic field, one part is attached to the frame and the other is attached to the window or door. Once the window or door opens, the magnetic field is broken and the alarm or chime will be activated.

Fantastic, low cost additional security for any home or business. Set to chime to welcome visitors and alert you to their presence, or set to alarm to deter and scare off intruders.

This style of alarm is widely used by police and local authorities as a simple but effective way to deter sneak-in burglaries.

Features

  • Simple and effective magnetic technology
  • Versatile - can be used on any door or window
  • Fast installation with an adhesive pad
  • Low battery indicator
  • Easy to use - chime or alarm function

page.title: Magnetic Chime & Alarm
page.description: A magnetic door or window alarm which sounds a chime or alarm to deter thieves or welcome visitors.
page.keywords: Door chime, window chime, window alarm, door alarm, home alarm, magnetic contact alarm

section.html:
Product Details

The magnetic door / window chime and alarm can be used to welcome visitors or deter thieves.

The device works by using magnetic technology, one side is fitted to the window or door and the other is fitted to the frame.

Once the door or window is opened and the magnetic field is broken it will trigger a chime or an alarm depending on which setting you have chose.

Could also be used on cupboards and internal doors, ideal to help prevent sneak in burglary.

Features

  • Powerful 110dBs siren or welcoming chime
  • Magnetic contact technology
  • Ideal to prevent sneak in burglary
  • For use on doors, windows and cupboards
  • Simple adhesive pad installation
  • Alerts you if doors, windows or cupboards are opened

page.title: Defender Door Handle Alarm
page.description: The Defender Door Handle Alarm is designed to alert you when someone is about to open the door. Uses magnetic field technology. Helps to prevent sneak-in burglary.
page.keywords: Defender, Door Handle Alarm, Door Open Sensor, Burglary, Detector

section.html:
Product Details

The door handle alarm is a clever detection alarm which knows when someone is about to open the door or touches the door handle and once triggered will set off a powerful 125 decibel alarm.

A perfect addition to home security, its versatility and ease of use means it can be used as and when required, in any room that need protecting.

Ideal for use in student halls, shared accommodation, internal rooms within your home or hotel / holiday rooms.

Features

  • 125dBs alarm
  • Sensitivity adjustment
  • Quick and simple to use
  • Versatile - can be used for a range of different situation
  • No installation required, simply hook around a door handle

page.title: Defender Door Wedge Alarm
page.description: A fantastic device which allows you to ventilate your home and stay secure. The door wedge can be set to armed and will alert you is someone tries to force open the door.
page.keywords: Defender, Door Wedge Alarm, Door Stopper alarm, ventilation alarm, door alert, door alarm

section.html:
Product Details

The Door Wedge Alarm is an ideal portable alarm to protect internal or external doors from intruders.

Allows you to ventilate your home during the hot weather, dry clothes or air rooms whilst cooking yet still keeps your home secure.

The alarm is used as a normal door wedge and keeps a door open at a closed angle to allow a room to be aired but not enough to allow entry. If someone was to force the door open the wedge will be activated and will release powerful 120 decibels alarm.

Features

  • ON/OFF switch
  • Robust design
  • Can be used as a normal door wedge or as an alarmed door wedge
  • 120dBs siren
  • Battery operated
  • Portable

page.title: PIR Chime & Alarm
page.description: This PIR Chime/Alarm is designed to detect movement in a specific area such as a window sill or door way, to reduce false alarms and protect certain areas. Helps to prevent sneak-in burglary.
page.keywords: Solon Security EL00015, Windowsill alarm, PIR Chime and Alarm, curtain alarm, pir sensor, burglary alarm, home alarm

section.html:
Product Details

The alarm works almost like an invisible beam and can be used to protect window sills, doorways, desks and tabletops. Designed to prevent sneak in burglaries or can be used as a welcoming chime.

Features

  • PIR motion detect technology
  • Reduces false alarms
  • 3 x AAA batteries (supplied)
  • 130dBs siren or welcoming chime

page.title: Defender Window Alert Alarm
page.description: An alarm designed to detect attempted break-ins, the alarm will be activated if the glass is hit or tapped. Comes with a highly visible warning sticker.
page.keywords: Defender EL00001, Window Alert Alarm, Window Shock Alarm, break-in detection, glass smash alarm, break in alarm, glass goor alarm

section.html:
Product Details

Once activated the siren will sound for 1 minute. If further shocks are sensed the alarm will be activated again for a further minute and so on. The adhesive pad doubles up as a warning sticker to deter opportunist thieves and help keep your home secure from potential intruders.

Features

  • 110dBs Siren
  • Suitable for all types or glass window or door panels
  • 2 x AAA batteries (supplied)
  • Self adhesive warning sticker provides maximum visual deterrent
  • Quick and easy installation
  • 1 year warranty

page.title: Defender Window Shock Alarm
page.description: The Defender Window Shock Alarm is a powerful anti-break in alarm which is able to detect attacks on a glass pane. As soon as someone attempts to break the glass a siren will sound. Also comes with a visually effective warning sign.
page.keywords: Defender EL00019, window shock alarm, window alert alarm, break-in detection, glass alarm, shock alarm, glass vibration, glass door alarm

section.html:
Product Details

The alarm is simply attached to the window by an adhesive pad. As soon as someone attempts to hit the window the alarm will be activated and a powerful 110dBs siren will sound for 1 minute. If further shocks are sensed the alarm will be activated again for a further minute and so on.

The adhesive pad doubles up as a warning sticker to deter opportunist thieves and help keep your home secure from potential intruders.

Features

  • Low battery indicator
  • 110dBs siren
  • Suitable for all types or glass window or door panels
  • 4 x LR44 cell batteries (supplied)
  • Self adhesive warning sticker provides maximum visual deterrent
  • Quick and easy installation
  • 1 year warranty

page.title: Panic Alarm
page.description: A wall mountable alarm which can be used in case of emergency in the home. Ideal for elderly and vulnverable people or to deter doorstep crime.
page.keywords: Panic Alarm, door step alarm, elderly alarm, ripcord alarm, emergency alarm, house alarm

section.html:
Product Details

A wall mountable panic alarm coloured to the Royal institute for the Blind recommendations for the partially sighted.

Once the cord is pulled a powerful 120 decibel alarm is activated. Ideal to have in your home to provide you and your family with a fixed point in case of an emergency.

The alarm is often fitted next to doors and is ideal for repeat victims of crime, hate crime, anti social behaviour and bogus callers.

Also ideal to be fitted in bedrooms and bathrooms in case an elderly or vulnerable person needs help within the home.

Features

  • Wall mountable
  • Ripcord activation
  • Flashing LED when armed
  • ON/OFF switch
  • Battery operated - no wiring required
  • Coloured to the Royal Institute for the Blind recommendations for the partially sighted

page.title: Alert Multi-Function Alarm
page.description: A multi-function alarm with 3 modes of operation including wall mounted panic alarm, door chime and variable motion sensor.
page.keywords: Door alarm, panic alarm, wall mounted alarm, shed alarm, caravan alarm, home alarm, loud alarm, door chime, personal alarm, portable alarm, battery alarm.

section.html:
Product Details

section.html:
Product Details

Its small and discreet size makes it suitable for any installation including homes, outhouses, sheds and garages.

Simple to arm and disarm using the key fob, once you arm the unit it will allow you enough time to leave the area and it will then be armed.

section.html:
Product Details

Great visual deterrent to deter thieves and send a clear warning that your valuables are security marked. Most burglaries are opportunist thieves looking for an easy target and simple warning signs such as this can have a significant effect.

Warning signs are a great way to keep your property security marked, recorded and keep thieves at bay.

Features

  • Window cling - doesn't leave any residue on glass
  • Low cost additional security
  • Visually effective in bold yellow and red
  • Measures 100 x 65mm

page.title: Doorstep Sellers Beware Sticker
page.description: A window sticker for doors and windows to deter thieves and cold callers.
page.keywords: Door step crime, security sticker, window warning sticker,

section.html:
Product Details

This is a strong message to target distraction burglary and cold callers. Distraction burglary is an increasingly common crime where a burglar will pretend to be visiting you for a valid reason such as to check your water meter or discuss road works near your home but what they are really doing is distracting you while someone else enters your home and looks for valuables to steal.

This sign is designed to deter opportunist thieves and also to remind you to say NO to cold callers. There is also a hotline number for you to call if you ever need to report a cold caller.

Features

  • Dual sided warning sign to deter thieves and remind you to say no to cold callers
  • Provides a hotline number in case you're cold called
  • Visually effective
  • Window cling - doesn't leave any residue
  • Measures 140 x 100mm

The Memo Minder MK11 is a fantastic device which recognises when someone walks past and plays a recorded message.

This is an invaluable tool which helps people who suffer from memory loss to complete an important daily task or action such as lock the door behind you, or take your pills in the morning.

Has been successfully used as part of the Home Office evaluated Distraction Burglary Kit which helped achieve an 80% improvement in good door step practice.

page.title: Door Chain Mirror
page.description: A mirror which helps you see who is calling while the chain is still secure.
page.keywords: Door chain mirror, doorchain mirror, mirror for door chain, door step crime, bogus caller, distraction burglary

section.html:
Product Details

The Door Chain Mirror is a great way to see who is at the door without releasing the chain.

Sometimes doors can be direct against a wall making it difficult for people to look around the door, or sometimes a visitor may stand too far to the side so you can't see who is calling.

The door chain mirror ensures that even in these circumstances you will still be able to ID a visitor before allowing access to your home.

Designed for the LOCK, STOP, CHAIN, CHECK campaign against doorstep crime.

Features

  • Comes with a choice of stickers including the 'LOCK, STOP, CHAIN, CHECK' message and 'Not sure? Don't open the door'
  • Ideal for doors which open against a wall
  • Enables you to get a good look at your visitor and ID them before you open the door
  • Features in Bogus caller and Door Step Crime campaigns

See this link for some interesting advice about Door Step Crime and Distraction Burglary information by North Yorkshire Police

http://www.northyorkshire.police.uk/10111

page.title: ID Card Magnifier
page.description: A magnifier which helps you to see a callers ID card. Ideal to help prevent bogus callers.
page.keywords: ID card check, ID card magnifier, credit card magnifier, ID authentication, bogus caller checker

section.html:
Product Details

The ID Card Magnifier is a great way to check small printed text such as ID cards and documents to ensure that your visitor provides the correct identification documents.

This product has successfully been used in distraction burglary kits by the police and local authorities which help to prevent door step crime such as distraction burglary and bogus callers.

This crime often involves criminals posing as a person of authority or utility workers who will attempt to gain entry to your home and steal valuables whilst you are distracted.

Make sure you check the ID of any visitor to your home and if you're unsure, don't open the door!

Carries the message LOCK, STOP, CHAIN, CHECK which is the police advice for good doorstep practice.

Features

  • Magnifies printed text and images to help you identify a caller
  • Ideal to keep by the door
  • Encourages you and members of your household to use police recommended door step practice
  • Carries the message LOCK, STOP, CHAIN, CHECK and further advice on how to prevent door step crime.

page.title: Sat-Nav Windscreen Cloth
page.description: A cloth developed by the police to wipe away marks left by satellite navigation systems. Helps prevent sat nav theft.
page.keywords: sat nav cloth, sat-nav, satellite navigation, sat nav theft, vehicle theft prevention, cloth for car, windscreen cloth

section.html:
Product Details

The Sat Nav Cloth has been developed by the Police who use these as a way too remove the tell-tale marks left on windscreens by satellite navigation systems.

Sat Nav's leave marks on a windscreen and advertise to thieves that your car may contain valuable items. It is important to wipe away the marks and take your sat nav with you when you leave your car.

The cloths come in a little pouch and are a great item to leave in your car or give to friends / relatives to remove the sucker rings every time you use your sat nav.

Remember, don't give it away. Wipe it away.

Car Theft Prevention Advice 

 West Mercia Police

You can significantly reduce the chance of your vehicle being targeted by taking a few simple precautions:

  • Disconnect and remove your sat nav every time you leave your car
  • Remove the suction mounted fittings and erase any marks they leave
  • Don't put the sat nav in the glove compartment - thieves may be watching you
  • Get your sat nav security marked - use forensic property marking kits or UV pens
  • Register it and any other valuable on the Immobilise national property database
  • Park in a well lit, busy area or a secure car park

page.title: Vehicle Air Freshener
page.description: A security vehicle air freshener which helps to deter thieves and remind you to remove your valuables from your vehicle.
page.keywords: vehicle theft, security air freshener, car warning sign, vehicle warning sign, car theft prevention

section.html:
Product Details

These vehicle air fresheners are a great way to tell thieves that no valuables have been left in your vehicle.

It also helps to remind you to make sure that whenever you leave your car you take any valuable item with you, such as sat-navs, iPods or MP3 players, bags and mobile phones.

A car is like a shopping display window for thieves, they will look inside the vehicle first to see if there is anything on display which they can quickly grab.

Make sure you're not a victim!

Features

page.title: Tamper Proof Tax Disc Holder
page.description: The Secur-i-Disc is a tamper proof security tax sidc holder which has been designed to help prevent tax disc theft.

section.html:
Product Details

The Secur-i-Disc is a tamper-proof tax disc holder which warns thieves that your tax disc cannot be removed.

Tax discs take seconds to steal and are sold on for about £30 after being cleaned up. The expense to the vehicle owner however is much higher as they have to deal with broken windows or doors and the cost of insurance premiums going up.

Police have said Blutack or razor blades are used to wipe off the disc's handwritten registration plate number, allowing a false one to replace it.

The tamper-proof holder means that any attempt to remove the disc would be fruitless and would leave the disc torn and unable to sell on.

Features

  • Prevents theft of tax disc
  • Displays a warning sign to criminals who know that any attempt to remove the disc will destroy the disc
  • Used by the police as an attempt to prevent car theft and the theft of tax discs

Product Details

A complete kit of replacement screws for vehicle registration plates which make them impossible to remove.

The screws are designed to only enable you to screw them one way, you need a special screwdriver to unscrew the plate. The kit comes complete with 4 x screws (for both front and back plates) in a range of 5 different sizes. The kit also comes with different coloured caps to act as an extra protection and lets thieves know that your car has anti-tamper screws.

Thieves use stolen number plates to disguise their own vehicle identity from recognition cameras to enable them to commit crimes such as theft of fuel, get-away vehicles from crime scenes or joy riding.

Don't be left a victim of identity theft, use these anti-tamper screws to protect your vehicle registration plate.

Features

Environmental Contribution

We recognise the importance of environmental considerations and are committed to a policy of ongoing care for the environment and will take these into account at all stages of business planning, development, product distribution and marketing whilst continuing to produce high quality products to our customer’s specification and satisfaction.

Solon Security imports and distributes products with electrical components; therefore we ensure we are compliant with WEEE regulations. (The Waste Electronic and Electrical Equipment)

About WEEE Environmental Regulations

Since July 2007, a system has been operating in the UK to take-back, reuse or treat and recycle used electrical and electronic equipment (EEE). This system is intended to reduce the amount of untreated waste electrical and electronic equipment (WEEE) going to landfill and to ensure that what gets separately collected is dealt with properly. Further information about the WEEE system is available on our website here: www.environment-agency.gov.uk/weee

Green Printing

Solon Security supplies catalogues to all trade customers, producing almost 15,000 catalogues annually. We therefore strive to use the most environmentally friendly printers possible and we now use one of the UK’s only carbon neutral printers who hold an accreditation to the World Land Trust Carbon Balancing programme. This means that through investing in environmental projects they have offset all the carbon the printing of our catalogues produce. In 2012 they carbon balanced 184 tonnes of carbon which equates to saving 15,450m2 of critically threatened tropical forest.

Carbon balancing through the World Land Trust meets the challenge of climate change through projects that both offset carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions and conserve biodiversity. More details on the World Land Trust Carbon Balanced programme are available at: www.carbonbalanced.org

They also hold an accreditation to the Forest Stewardship Council’s Chain of Custody (FSC COC) programme. This means we can be certain that papers and boards used to produce our printed matter can be traced back through the production chain to the sustainable source of the timber used in the wood pulp production.

For more information about the FSC and the Chain of Custody Programme, visit their website at www.fsc-uk.org

Privacy Policy and Data Protection Statement

The privacy of our users is very important to us and we take care to safeguard your rights. This page explains how we use your personal information and explains our Data Protection Statement.

DATA PROTECTION STATEMENT

The following is the covering Data Protection Statement that Solon Security fully adheres to:

Solon Security follows the Data Protection Act 1998 and is committed to follow the eight principles laid out in the Act. Any data supplied by an individual to Solon Security will not be used in a manner, which is contrary to these principles. Data will be held in a secure manner, protected from unauthorised access and use and not be passed to a third party. Solon Security recognises the rights of an individual and will ensure they are fully complied with.

PRIVACY POLICY

The following is the covering Privacy Statement that Solon Security fully adheres to.

What information do we collect?

We will only collect information from you necessary to collect, handle and process your order, and communicate with you about your order, or to answer any enquiries you send to us.

What do we use personal information for?

We may need to contact you about an enquiry you have made or about a product you are interested in.

For example, if you are enquiring about a product we may need your telephone number and/or email address to contact you.

We are the sole owner of the information collected on this site. We will never sell, share, or rent this information to others.

Sharing

We use third party shipping companies, e.g. Royal Mail, FedEx, etc. to ship orders, and a third party credit card payment processing system to bill users for goods and services. These companies do not retain, share, store or use personally identifiable information for any secondary purposes.

Contacting you for other purposes

From time to time, unless you ask us not to during the order process, we may contact you about other products we think you might be interested in, using the email address you have given us. You can opt out of this at any time by using the unsubscribe button on an email, or by emailing the websites main contact email address with the subject ‘unsubscribe’.

Information collected automatically

We automatically collect information about your visit to our site. This information is used to make your visit to our site more efficient, and to help us follow browsing preferences on our site so that we can make regular improvements. Our external web host may also automatically log your IP address, a unique identifier for your computer or other access device.

What cookies do we use?

Cookies

Cookies are small text files that can be used by websites to make a user's experience more efficient.

This site uses session cookies. Session cookies are never saved onto your computer hard drive and they do not collect any information from your computer. Session cookies expire at the end of your browser session and can remove themselves from your browser after the session has been inactive for a specified length of time, usually 20 minutes.

We will store a persistent cookie so that you may retrieve the products in your shopping cart with no need to go through re-choosing all of them again. However, the cookie will eventually expire if there is no activity in your cart, e.g. view, add to, etc., for a number of days. This website's cookies do not contain any personally identifiable information. If a user rejects the cookie, they may still use our site, but the user will experience limited functionality in some areas of our site. For example, the user will not be able to process an order through our shopping checkout area.

If you do want to delete any cookies on your computer, please refer to the instructions for your file management software to locate the file or directory that stores cookies. You can access them through some types of browser. More information about cookies, including how to block them and/or delete them, can be found at AboutCookies.org.

Links

This web site may contain links to other sites. Please be aware that Solon Security is not responsible for the privacy practices of such other sites. We encourage our users to be aware when they leave our site and to read the privacy statements of each and every web site that collects personally identifiable information. This privacy statement applies solely to information collected by Solon Security.

Security

We take every precaution to protect our users' information. When users submit sensitive information via the website, this information is protected both on-line and off-line.

We do everything in our power to protect user-information off-line. All of our users' information, is restricted in our offices. Only employees who need the information to perform a specific job are granted access to personally identifiable information. Our systems are password-protected and ALL employees are kept up-to-date on our security and privacy practices. Our employees are notified and/or reminded about the importance we place on privacy and what they can do to ensure our customers' information is protected. Finally, the servers that we store personally identifiable information on are kept in a secure environment, in a locked server case, in a locked secure room.

If you have any questions about the security of our website you can send an email to sales@solonsecurity.co.uk

Requests for information

You can ask for a copy of any information we hold about you at any time (for which we may charge a small fee).

Notification of Changes

If we decide to change our privacy policy, we will post those changes on this page so our website visitors are always aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we disclose it. If at any point we decide to use personally identifiable information in a manner different from that stated at the time it was collected, we would notify users by email. Users will have a choice as to whether or not we use their information in this different manner. We will use information in accordance with the privacy policy under which the information was collected.

Your Feedback

At Solon Security, your privacy is extremely important. If you have any questions about the privacy statement, the practices of this site, or your dealings with us, please contact us and let us know.

Thank you.

page.title: Home Security Advice
page.description: Essential home security advice from the experts. Keeping your home, flat or apartment safe and security using locks, CCTV, warning signs and alarms.

section.html:
Home Security

Posted Thursday 6th February 2014. 

Home Owners

Getting the basics right will significantly reduce your chance of being burgled. Most burglaries are still opportunistic and your job is to make your house less appealing to break into than the ones nearby!

Think how you would get into your house if you were locked out? If you can get in, so can a burglar. Pay particular attention to areas where they can break in without being seen from the road or neighbours houses.

Basic tips

- Fit strong locks to your doors and windows

- Use the locks you have. Snaplocks for windows lock automatically when you shut them.

- Keep keys out of sight

- Use visually effective warning signs, alarms and CCTV cameras - even if they're fake!

- Keep valuables out of sight

- Use timer switches to make it look like you're at home while you're out

- Use good security lighting

 

Flat or Shared Accommodation

Security Advice

All Flat owners need to take special care of letting people they don't know into the communal areas.

If you live in a first or second floor flat, you should take the same security measures you would for a house.
 
Flats above the second floor need to take a slightly different approach because of fire regulations and the reduced likelihood of access through the windows

If you live in shared accommodation with people you don't know very well, you should be wary of your house mates as you don't always know who you can trust, or who they're letting into the house while you're not there.

Make your you room is fitted with a lock and a key, and make sure you always lock up behind you. Don't leave any valuables such as laptops or bags in the communal areas.

 

Essential Security Items (Must have)

- British Standard 5 lever lock

- Intercom

- Deadlocking Night-latch

- Door Viewer

- Door chain or restrictor

 

Other Security Items (Nice to have)

- Additional bolts

- Door chain mirror

- Sneak in alarms (Door Handle Alarm & Door Wedge Alarm)

Distraction Burglary

What is distraction burglary?

Distraction burglary or bogus caller theft is a crime which has affected many unlikely victims who open the door to a person who gains entry to your home by tricking you in some form or another with the intent to commit a crime.

The most common way to trick you is to tell you they are an official representative such as a police officer, utility company employee or a council worker. Sometimes they also pretend to be a sales person with a 'too good to be true' offer.

Once they gain entry to your home they then distract you while they take your valuables.

Who are the victims?

- 77% of victims were female
- 23% were male
- 74% of victims lived alone
- 26% lived with someone
- 12% lived in sheltered accommodation
- The average age of victims was 78 years

An analysis of police records over the 1999-2001 period indicates an average of 14,500
reported crimes per year.

Statistics can be found here on the Neighbourhood Watch website

Once you have become a victim you are at risk of being put onto a 'suckers' list in whice the criminals will sell on victims details to other criminals who will then target you for other tricks such as scam mail.

If you have been a victim of this crime or you think someone may have tried to enter your home under a false pretense it is vitally important that you report it. Many victims are not aware they have become a victim and often think their valuable has been lost and question their own memory.

How can you prevent this? 

LOCK, STOP, CHAIN, CHECK

LOCK   

Make sure that your door is locked when you're at home. Don't unlock it until you're sure who is on the other side. Be extra careful who you answer your door to - if you're unsure, don't open your door.

Make sure that your back door is closed and locked before answering your front door - thieves sometimes work in pairs, with one entering through the back door while the other knocks on the front door.

STOP

If someone appears at your door and you're not expecting any visitors, check that all the doors are locked. Look through the spy-hole viewer or one of your windows to see who it is.

Install an outside light above your door. When someone calls at your door, turn the light on to get a good look at them. Position the light so that it lights up the caller's face.

CHAIN

If you decide to open the door, put the door chain or bar on first. Keep the bar or chain on while you are talking. Normally, when the door is shut and locked, leave the bar or chain off, in case you need to get out in an emergency - such as a fire, or if someone wanted to enter your property if you needed help.

If you need glasses to read the caller's ID card, close and lock your door before going to get your glasses. Never leave the door open and unattended.

CHECK

Ask for, and double check, the caller’s identity card. Keep your door chain on while you do this. And, if you're still not sure, ask for a number that you can ring to confirm their identity. If they can't show you any identification, don't let them in.

Information taken from Thames Valley Police Crime Prevention

section.html:
Product Details

The two tone alarm acts as a great deterrent to unsuspecting opportunist thieves. The Padlock Alarm has a powerful 110dBs two tone siren which activates when the lock is tampered with.

Dual use:

As an alarm- to deter intruders simply replace the shackle in the correct position and lock. After a short delay the alarm will sound a warning beep if tampered with. If further movement is detected the siren will sound an impressive two tone siren scaring off would be thieves.

As a normal padlock-Simply reverse the shackle and lock to secure for use as a high security padlock and a strong visual deterrent.

Ideal for:

The GuardCam LED Light uses PIR motion sensing technology to detect intruders. Once activated it will flood the area with a security light, release an audio warning and record footage onto an SD card.

This all-in-one security light and CCTV camera is ideal for outdoor use and not only helps to capture intruders or ASB offenders but also helps to deter further activity as the area will remain lit whenever there is movement.

Security lighting on its own is sometimes enough to deter thieves and criminals however if on the occasion it is not the device will capture evidence for you to report to the police.

  • 160º PIR detection angle
  • Connects to mains power (electrician recommended to fit)
  • Records to SD (64GB max, 2GB card supplied)

  • Video or image recording
  • 8 x 11.8W LEDs for eco-friendly, powerful output
  • Records 20 second image stream

page.title: FakeTV Burglar Deterrent
page.description: The FakeTV lights up a room just like a real TV giving the impression someone is at home.
page.keywords: FakeTV, fake tv, burglar deterrent, fake tv burglar deterrent, home burglar deterrent, intruder deterrent, home security light

section.html:
Product Details
 
The FakeTV is designed to light up a room just like a real TV, giving the impression to would be thieves that you are at home watching TV.

Opportunist thieves will target homes which look like an easy picking, especially those which look empty the evening.

People often leave their TV's or lights on while they're out at night to put off potential burglars, however this wastes energy and can cause units to overheat if left too long.

The Fake TV is a great alternative as it uses less energy than a standard lamp and has timer settings for added effect. It uses a built-in computer to control super bright LED's to produce a lighting display in a range of colours, tones, light flickers and pauses just like a real television does. Test subjects were unable to tell the difference between a real TV and the FakeTV.

Featured in the '10 best security gadgets' in the Independent

As seen on - BBC's the Dragon's Den, The Gadget Show, ITV's This Morning.

Features

  • Presents a random display of lights
  • Deters burglars
  • Peace of mind while you're away
  • Time switch - use any time of the day or night
  • Ideal for use while you're away on holiday
  • Gives the illusion holiday homes or vacant properties are lived in
  • Never repeats, continuously changes the sequence
  • Uses less power than a TV, about the same as a standard lamp.
  • Mains adaptor included

page.title: Student Safety Guide 2014
page.description: Tips and advice for staying safe while at university to prevent students from becoming a victim of crime including cycle theft, bag theft, burglary, muggings and attacks.
page.keywords: student crime, student security, university crime, university security, student safety, theft, burglary, cycle theft

section.html:
The Ultimate Student Safety Guide 2014

Posted on Tuesday 11th March, 2014

Are you a prime target?

Criminals tend to target students due to the fact that they often carry high value electronics such as iPods, laptops and smart phones, and are less likely to be security conscious.

Whether you're still living at home or have moved out and living in student accommodation or shared flats, it is important to be aware of your belongings, look after your home and most importantly look after yourself. 

Our Top 10 Tips

1. Mark your valuables - Using the student property marking kit, make sure your valuables such as phones, laptops, TVs are marked using the UV pen. Use your university address and parents name, house number and postcode. On the marking card make a list of all the items you have marked and include a serial number and description if possible. 

2. Lock up - You may feel like you live with people you trust, however you never know who might be let in or what your house mates might be doing while you leave your room unattended. Lock up your bedroom door even if you're going to the bathroom or kitchen.  

Use padlocks and bike locks to secure other valuables such as bikes, cupboards and bags. 

3. Be in charge of security - Make sure doors and windows are locked up at night, don't assume someone else will do it. Living away from home for the first time can take some adjustment, but make sure this one is top of your list. 

4. Personal Safety - carry a personal safety alarm around with you at all times. We have a range of alarms available. Most can be attached to a keychain and some have bag attachments too. We also have some with an 'in case of emergency' torch which is also great to help find your keyhole in the dark! Male students are at a high risk of being attacked in the street so these alarms are not just for women. 

5. Stay safe on a night out -

Think ahead and plan your route home. Book a taxi or or arrange a lift from a friend. If you have to walk or use public transport, stay with friends and make sure you have your personal attack alarm with you. Tell your friends what route you're taking and let them know when you're home safe.

Eat before you go out , drink plenty of water before you go and in between alcoholic drinks. 

6. Do not leave valuables in sight. - Keep cash, mobiles, MP3 players, purses etc out of sight from potential thieves, whether you're in the library, in class, in your car or at home. Make sure these items are marked, hidden or even better locked away using a portable safe.

7. If you own a vehicle - Remember that criminals may target cars which look like an easy target. They come to the student areas hoping to find a vehicle with valuables on display including sat - navs, laptops and other electronics. With this in mind, never leave belongings in your car, always lock the windows, doors and sunroof even if its just for a few minutes. Use signs such as the award winning 'Don't Bother Kit'  to warn off opportunist thieves. Be aware that the marks left by sat nav suckers can entice a thief. Rub these away using sat-nav cloths.

8. If you own a bike - Mark your bike with using a Bike Marking Kit  and make sure you have a decent bike lock. Look out for security ratings and certificates ratings. Any bike lock which is Gold Sold Secure rated is a highly secure bike lock. TheMaster Lock U Bar Bike Lock ticks all of the boxes. Remember, it only takes seconds to steal a bike, so make sure its locked up whenever you leave it.

The Padlock Alarm is a great way to keep your bike secure, and will release an alarm if tampered with. This can be used for bikes, sheds and gates to keep valuables secure. 

9. Use Home Alarms - Use home alarms which are easy to install and remove, or portable sensors which don't need to be fixed to a wall. Perfect when you're living in rented accommodation. Motion sensors can be set to chime or alarm so you know who is entering or leaving a property. If you're expecting visitors set to chime, if you're not, set to alarm. You can also use door wedge alarms or door handle alarms to your bedroom door.

10. Protect Windows and Doors - Use mortice locks on doors and locks with removable keys on windows. One of the most popular items of security used by the police is a window shock alarm. This is a great way to protect windows from attack and also deters thieves as the adhesive pad doubles up as a warning sticker. 

Use these tips as a guide and it will help to make your independent student journey easier and more enjoyable.

Now all you have to do is remember to get those essays finished in time!

Advice and tips are by Lincolnshire Police and the complete university guide - online.

page.title: Through the Eyes of a Burglar
page.description: Are you a sitting target to thieves? Learn how to see your home through the eyes of a burglar to prevent you from becoming the next target.
page.keywords: thieves, burglary, home security
page.meta_title: Through the Eyes of a Burglar

section.html:
Looking through the eyes of a burglar

Posted Wednesday 12th March, 2014

Opportunist thieves spend time assessing home before they make a move, to decide if it's worth the risk.

We are here to help you learn how to identify weak spots on your property, to keep the burglars at bay.

1. Is anyone home?

An empty house is less risk, Signs of life will put thieves off so while you're out fool thieves with timer switches and FakeTVs. If you're going on holiday, place lights on timers, ask neighbours to check the house daily and close curtains, move mail etc. 

2. Is there any CCTV or alarms fitted?

Anything which will increase the risk factor will make a burglar think twice. If CCTV is fitted, will it alert someone of a break in. Will they be able to identify them? If alarms are fitted, do they look old and easy to disable? 

3. Look through the windows. 

Can you spot anything worth taking? Laptops, computers, TVs, tablet devices, handbags? A burglar will only want to enter a house which is worth the risk. If they see something on display, a burglar will feel almost entitled to go in and steal it. Are the windows old and easy to break in, or are they new with secure locks?

4. Check the door. 

Does it look easy to gain entry? Are there any weaknesses on the hinge, lock side or weaker panels which could be forced open. Is there a glass panel which could be smashed to gain access. Are there any keys in reach through the letter box or window. 

5. Is there anywhere to hide? 

If a burglar can be seen from the road then they may not feel safe breaking in. Bushes, fences or walls help keep them concealed while they're breaking in. Or they can remain hidden while they're assessing the home. Trim back hedges, bushes and trees.

6. Are there any other entry points?

Burglars will look to see if they can gain entry from other areas, such pulling a bin over to gain access to an upper floor window. Or using smaller windows to reach through and open larger windows. Even some cat flaps are large enough for a small adult or teenager.Cat flats can also allow burglars to reach through and grab keys or door handles.

7. Is there anything which will cause risk?

Burglars don't like trouble and like to remain inconspicuous. Use security lighting, CCTV, Alarms, dogs or gravel to use as obstacles if a burglar attempted to target your home. The GuardCam CCTV Light is a 3-in-1 deterrent and once activated will flood the area with light, record footage and will release an audio warning such as a dog bark. This should hopefully result in a prompt, empty handed exit. 

8. Hidden 'in case of emergency' keys

Check behind plant pots, under the mat, behind rocks or bricks nearby. If you leave a key outside your home you are not only at risk from thieves gaining entry but you are also at risk of not being insured. If you have to leave a key, use a key safe. The Supra GE C500 Key Safe is the most secure Key Safe in the UK and is approved by Police and insurance companies.  

9. Distraction Burglary

Thieves often target vulnerable or elderly people and pretend to be an official visitor from the police, a neighbourhood watch, a utility company or charity to try to gain access to the home. Once they're in they scope out the property, ask questions to see when the house is empty and even use an accomplice to distract you while they steal valuables such as purses, handbags, phones or jewellery. 

10. Shed and Garage Security

Criminals know that sheds, garages and outhouses tend to be less secure, unlikely to have alarms fitted and are less risky to enter. They also know that items of value tend to be stored in them. Use alarmed padlocks, shed alarms, hasp and staples with concealed screws and security signs to deter thieves. 

 

Take a look at this video by Gwent Police which shows exactly how criminals operate, through the eyes of a burglar. 

 

)

page.title: FakeTV Burglar Deterrent
page.description: The FakeTV lights up a room just like a real TV giving the impression someone is at home.

section.html:
Product Details
 
The FakeTV is designed to light up a room just like a real TV, giving the impression to would be thieves that you are at home watching TV.

Opportunist thieves will target homes which look like an easy picking, especially those which look empty the evening.

People often leave their TV's or lights on while they're out at night to put off potential burglars, however this wastes energy and can cause units to overheat if left too long.

The Fake TV is a great alternative as it uses less energy than a standard lamp and has timer settings for added effect. It uses a built-in computer to control super bright LED's to produce a lighting display in a range of colours, tones, light flickers and pauses just like a real television does. Test subjects were unable to tell the difference between a real TV and the FakeTV.

Featured in the '10 best security gadgets' in the Independent.

As seen on - BBC's the Dragon's Den, The Gadget Show, ITV's This Morning.

Features

  • Presents a random display of lights
  • Deters burglars
  • Peace of mind while you're away
  • Time switch - use any time of the day or night
  • Ideal for use while you're away on holiday
  • Gives the illusion holiday homes or vacant properties are lived in
  • Never repeats, continuously changes the sequence

page.title: Holiday Security Checklist
page.description: Consider how to keep your home secure while you're away. Use this home security checklist to make everything has been covered.

section.html:
Keep Your Home Secure While You're Away

1- Prepare your home

If a garden looks overgrown a burglar may think the home is unoccupied. Make sure you cut back any hedges and mow your lawn before you go away. If you are away for a longer period of time consider asking a friend to come around and tend o your garden or hire a gardener. 

Lock away all tools, ladders or outdoor furniture into your shed or house, as thieves may use this to force their way into your home. 

2 - Secure Valuables

Mark all valuables with a permanent UV pen which uses invisible ink which the Police will be able to identify. Mark items with your postcode, house number and contact details. 

Make sure valuables are kept out of site and hidden in a discreet location. Avoid obvious places like under mattresses or drawers. 

3 - Make your home look lived in 

Use timer switches and a FakeTV to make your home seem lived in. A timer switch can turn lights on and off automatically at pre-set times, while a FakeTV makes it appear someone is at home watching TV. 

If you have a close neighbour, consider asking them to come around and open / close your curtains, collect mail and make sure everything is OK.

Cancel any newspaper or milk deliveries, and if you're away for a long period of time consider having your mail redirected.

4 - Don't advertise you're away

Be careful about who will know that you're away. Keep it quiet on social networking sites and be aware of who might be listening to conversations such as your taxi driver. Don't put your address on luggage labels, use a mobile phone number instead, and don't change your voicemail to state that you're away. 

5 - Secure your home

Finally, make sure all doors and windows are fitted with British standard locks and lock them all before you leave. If you have a home alarm fitted make sure batteries are fresh if required and set the alarm before you leave. If you have asked neighbours to stop by, ensure they are able to use the alarm. 

Holiday Security Pack

We have worked with crime prevention officers to produce a specialist holiday security pack which includes everything you need to make sure your home is secure while you're away. 

24 Hour Segment Timer - allows lamps or other electrical devices to be turned on or off automatically while you're away. It works by manually setting 15 minute segments to an on/off position with the option to choose up to 48 segments on or off in a 24 hour period.

Key Fob PIR Autodialer - This is a motion sensor alarm which once activated will not only sound an alarm but will also dial a pre-set number and play a pre-recorded message. 

PIR Alarm with RF Key Fob - A fast and easy to install motion sensor alarm which can be operated with a key fob. 

Permanent UV Marker Pen - Make sure all of your valuables are marked with your postcode, house number and contact details. 

FakeTV Burglar Deterrent - A clever gadget as seen on 'Dragons Den' and 'The One Show'. This device uses less energy than a standard lamp but will make it appear someone is at home watching TV. Operates on a dusk till dawn setting. 

The Holiday Security Pack can be bought here

page.title: Bike Security Guide
page.description: The ultimate bike security guide with advice from the experts on how to keep your bike secure where ever you are. Advice on bike locks, bike anchors, and bike chains.

section.html:
The Bike Security Guide 2014

With more cyclists on the road than ever before and the average price of a bike costing almost £250 it has become increasingly important to keep your bike secure and safe. 

Opportunist thieves know bikes are often easy pickings due to a lack of security. Bikes are often not marked with owners details which makes them easy to sell on and less risky to the thief as they cannot be linked to the crime. 

The British Crime Survey highlights that more than half a million bikes are stolen each year! Follow these tips to help ensure your bike is not one of them.

Top 5 bike security mistakes

Problem 1:

Only 5% of stolen bikes are returned to their owners, as bikes are not marked and Police have no way of identifying the owner. 

Resolution:

Mark your bike with your details using a UV Bike Marking Kit or by using the RetainaGuard Bike Marking Kit which uses a unique code and stores your details on the ISR database. If your bike is stolen and recovered, the Police will check this database and your bike can be returned to you. 

Problem 2:

Low quality bike locks are easily cut.

Resolution:

You should be looking to spend about 10% of the value of your bike on security. A good way to make sure the bike lock is secure is to check the security rating or certificates. Police always recommend Sold Secure or Secured by Design bike locks as they will have been through rigorous testing laid out by the Association of Chief Police Officers and by insurance companies. The Master Lock Gold Sold Secure Bike Lock has achieved the highest level of security by Sold Secure and is a Police preferred lock. It is available for less than £30 and is well worth the investment. 

Problem 3:

I don't have a safe place at home to store my bike.

Resolution:

It is advised to keep your bike in a locked shed or garage. If you don't have this available you can buy anchor plates for floors and walls and use high security chains to secure your bike. Use a rain cover if it is being kept outside. The Master Lock all in one kit is available which includes everything you need to secure your bike. 

Problem 4:

How to secure bikes in public areas

Resolution:

Avoid leaving your bike in a dimly lit area where thieves prefer to operate. Keep your bike secure in a location where thieves can easily be seen. If you are leaving your bike unattended, even for just a couple of minutes, always ensure it is locked and secure.

Problem 5

Using the wrong style of bike lock. 

Resolution: 

There are different styles of bike locks, the main ones being U-Locks (also known as D-Locks) and chains. They also come with either a key lock or a combination code. To increase the security level of your bike it is often advised to use two bike locks - one to secure your back wheel to the frame, and another to secure your front wheel to the frame. One or both of these should also be secured to a fixed object.

U-Locks are often more secure and come with brackets so can be attached to your bike when you're riding. Cables and chains are lighter and more versatile. Use a lock which suits your needs. 

You could also use a padlock alarm to secure a chain together which will sound a loud 130 decibel siren if tampered with. 

REMEMBER... Never buy a stolen bike. If there is no demand, the market will not operate. Only buy from legitimate stores and shops.

27 June 2014

Top 10 Holiday Security Products for under £20

We have put together a list of 10 ways to stay safe and secure while away on holiday for under £20. Holidays are a time to relax and enjoy yourself. Make sure your holiday is not ruined by pick pockets, thieves and criminals at home or away.

Read more.  

25 May 2014

Bike Security Guide 2014

Opportunist thieves know bikes are often easy pickings due to a lack of security. Bikes are often not marked with owners details which makes them easy to sell on and less risky to the thief as they cannot be linked to the crime. 
The British Crime Survey highlights that more than half a million bikes are stolen each year! Follow these tips to help ensure your bike is not one of them. 
 
Read more.  

20 April 2014

Holiday Security Checklist

While you're away on holiday, your home could be at greater risk from thieves. We have worked with crime prevention teams to put together a holiday security pack which covers all of the essentials you will need to secure your home. 
Read our holiday security check list here. 
 
Read more.  

12 March 2014

Through the eyes of a burglar

Opportunist thieves spend time assessing home before they make a move, to decide if it's worth the risk. We have put together a list of 10 ways a burglar would consider breaking into your home. 
Have a read, then take a walk outside your home to see how you would react if you were a burglar.
 
Read more.  

11 March 2014

Student Safety Guide 2014

Criminals tend to target students due to the fact that they often carry high value electronics such as iPods, laptops and smart phones, and are less likely to be security conscious.
Whether you're still living at home or have moved out and living in student accommodation or shared flats, it is important to be aware of your belongings, look after your home and most importantly look after yourself. 
 
Read more.  

9 February 2014

Distraction Burglary

Distraction burglary or bogus caller theft is a crime which has affected many unlikely victims who open the door to a person who gains entry to your home by tricking you in some form or another with the intent to commit a crime. 
In this article we'll show you how they select their victims and how you can prevent becoming one of them. 
 
Read more.  

28 January 2014

Home / Flat Security Advice

Getting the basics right will significantly reduce your chance of being burgled. Most burglaries are still opportunistic and your job is to make your house less appealing to break into than the ones nearby!
Think how you would get into your house or flat if you were locked out. If you can get in, so can a burglar. 
 
Read more.

Top 10 Holiday Security Products for under £20

1. Secret Pocket

Protect your valuables such as passports and cash whilst travelling by using a secret pocket - a wallet with a neck tie which can be worn underneath clothing to prevent pick pocketers. 

2. Door Wedge Alarm

The Defender Door Wedge Alarm is a great way to ventilate a room and add extra security, if someone was to push the door open the door wedge would compress and a loud siren would activate. Perfect for holiday apartments and hotel rooms, or for those hot days at home.

3. Defender Mini All Purpose Alarm

This ingenious personal alarm can also be used as a bag alarm, panic alarm, door alarm and an emergency torch. Prevents pick pocketers and deters thieves. The alarm works by pulling the lanyard away from the alarm which releases the pin and activates a loud 135dBs siren. Small and compact enough to keep on you at all times. 

4. Door Handle Alarm

A clever security device which can be placed on the inside of a door handle. If someone tries to touch the outside door handle the alarm will activate before they even get chance to open the door. Great way to deter thieves or alert you that someone is close by. 

5. ZipClip Carabiner Hook

This is one of the simplest but effective ways of protecting your bags while traveling. It not only deters thieves but also allows you to enjoy your holiday without the fear of being pick pocketed.  A thief would need to use two hands to break open the ZipClip Carabiner hook and enter your bag, which would deter them instantly.

6. Master Lock Portable Safe

Keep your phone, wallet, passport etc kept in this lightweight portable which comes with its own cable. Simply find a fixed object such as a post or table and feel safe knowing your valuables are locked away. Perfect for days out at the beach or at the hotel pool. 

7. Portable PIR Chime & Alarm

This motion detection alarm is designed to detect movement in one zone or 'beam.' The alarm can be placed on a table top, windowsill or floor and will only activate if someone walks past the invisible beam. For only £7.50, this alarm is unbeatable!

8. Purse Dipping Bells

These bells are great to keep on your purse or bag, if someone tries to take it while you're not looking the bells will jingle to alert you. These have had countless success stories and for 60p are a great buy.

9. Property Marking Kit

A low cost security essential which allows you to mark all of your valuables such as iPods, phones, tablets and cameras with your contact details in invisible ink. You can then record this onto a record card as proof the item belongs to you. 

10. Phone Security Cable

Available in black or white, the mobile phone security cable is designed to ensure your phone is always attached to you preventing thieves from snatching it from bags and pockets. It also prevents smashed screens in case of accidental dropping.
